title: Can we count them? Disabled children and their households
abstractText:
The limitations of UK national data on disabled children and their families are widely recognised. This study aims to contribute to the development of more robust national data on this population by scoping existing data sources and by generating new information from two currently available data sets. 
 
The research team will undertake:

  • a consultation with key stakeholders, users of disability research, survey  methodologists and academics with expertise in their field
  • a quality assessment of national and regional data sources on disabled children and evaluate their strengths and limitations.
  • a detailed secondary analysis of data on disabled children and their households from the Family Resources Survey (2002-3) and the Families and Children Study (2001-2)

In addition to reports, conference presentations and published academic papers, the University of Warwick will host a national seminar to disseminate to key stakeholders and users of childhood disability data the findings of the study and to promote debate about the implications for the development of future data sources.
